title: pgmath fails to build on Ubuntu (16.04 and maybe later)
body:
@junghans @tinlun 

I tried installing `flang` in a Docker container based on Ubuntu 16.04. I tried that using both `gcc-7` and `gcc-8`. The `pgmath` dependency fails to build with segfault.


### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install pgmath # On Ubuntu 16.04
```

### Error Message

```
==> Building pgmath [CMakePackage]                                                                                                                [1532/30305]
==> Executing phase: 'cmake'
==> Executing phase: 'build'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 2:
    'make' '-j32'

4 errors found in build log:
  >> 357    Segmentation fault (core dumped)
     358    lib/common/CMakeFiles/mth_z2yy.dir/build.make:63: recipe for target 'lib/common/mth_z2yy.c' failed
  >> 359    make[2]: *** [lib/common/mth_z2yy.c] Error 139
     360    make[2]: *** Deleting file 'lib/common/mth_z2yy.c'
     361    make[2]: Leaving directory '/tmp/root/spack-stage/spack-stage-TbIWzt/flang-flang_20180612/spack-build'
     362    CMakeFiles/Makefile2:1044: recipe for target 'lib/common/CMakeFiles/mth_z2yy.dir/all' failed
  >> 363    make[1]: *** [lib/common/CMakeFiles/mth_z2yy.dir/all] Error 2
     364    make[1]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
```
that activate the full debug output. 


### Information on your system

Ubuntu 16.04

### Reason

The default for `awk` in Ubuntu is `mawk`. If I read it right, `pgmath` uses `awk` to generate some of its own source code. `mawk` simply segfaults when running that `awk` command. Using `gawk` to run that awk command seems to be OK.
